channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [GRA1/SGP1][Dedicated Servers] - Network equipment version upgrade
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 29, 21:00 UTC  -  Nov 30, 00:00 UTC

Aug 24, 17:44 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 29/11/2023 21:00 UTC
End time : 30/11/2023 00:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will be doing a version upgrade on multiple network equipment.

item.title: [GLOBAL][Baremetal] - Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) removal
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Oct 3, 08:00 UTC  -  Nov 3, 10:50 UTC

Aug 2, 14:39 UTC
Scheduled - Start time: 03/10/2023 08:00 UTC
End time: 03/11/2023 10:50 UTC
Service impact: The Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) will no longer be available after 03/10/2023
Service improvement: The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-8-based rescue system (rescue64-pro) for all Baremetal products.
Customers should start using the new Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer).
The old Web interface is no longer present on the new version.
Please follow this procedure to troubleshoot hardware problems: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm/en-dedicated-servers-hardware-diagnostics?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB0043506

item.title: [RBX6][DedicatedServers] - Racks 46E18 - 46E19 - 46E17
item.description:
Aug 22, 20:08 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 22/08/2023 10:52 UTC
End Time : 22/08/2023 20:05 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the racks 46E17, 46E18 and 46E19 were unreachable.
Root cause : Cooling system issue
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Aug 22, 15:35 UTC
Identified - All servers in rack 46E19 aren't impacted anymore.
Our teams are currently working on impacted severs located in racks 46E17 and 46E18.

Aug 22, 11:53 UTC
Update - After investigation, servers in these racks 46E17 and 46E19 are also impacted.
Our technical teams continue to work on this issue.

Aug 22, 10:56 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 22/08/2023 10:52 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the rack 46E18 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [GRA1][Private/Public network] - G115A10/G115A09/G115A08
item.description:
Aug 19, 19:55 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 19/08/2023 12:54 UTC
End time : 19/08/2023 19:20 UTC
Service status : The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : It was due to a malfunction on the waterleak.

Aug 19, 13:44 UTC
Update - Service impact : Public network is operational again on the rack G115A10.
Some servers are unreachable on.

Aug 19, 13:25 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Aug 19, 13:05 UTC

Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
